00022 namespace GeographicLib {
00023 
00024   class CircularEngine;
00025 
00026   /**
00027    * \brief The evaluation engine for SphericalHarmonic
00028    *
00029    * This serves as the backend to SphericalHarmonic, SphericalHarmonic1, and
00030    * SphericalHarmonic2.  Typically end-users will not have to access this
00031    * class directly.
00032    **********************************************************************/
00033 
00034   class GEOGRAPHIC_EXPORT SphericalEngine {
00035   private:
00036     typedef Math::real real;
00037     // An internal scaling of the coefficients to avoid overflow in
00038     // intermediate calculations.
00039     static const real scale_;
00040     // Move latitudes near the pole off the axis by this amount.
00041     static const real eps_;
00042     static const std::vector<real> Z_;
00043     SphericalEngine();        // Disable constructor
00044 
00045   public:
00046     /**
00047      * Supported normalizations for associate Legendre polynomials.
00048      **********************************************************************/
00049     enum normalization {
00050       /**
00051        * Fully normalized associated Legendre polynomials.  See
00052        * SphericalHarmonic::full for documentation.
00053        *
00054        * @hideinitializer
00055        **********************************************************************/
00056       full = 0,
00057       /**
00058        * Schmidt semi-normalized associated Legendre polynomials.  See
00059        * SphericalHarmonic::schmidt for documentation.
00060        *
00061        * @hideinitializer
00062        **********************************************************************/
00063       schmidt = 1,
00064     };
00065 
00066     /**
00067      * \brief Package up coefficients for SphericalEngine
00068      *
00069      * This packages up the \e C, \e S coefficients and information about how
00070      * the coefficients are stored into a single structure.  This allows a
00071      * vector of type SphericalEngine::coeff to be passed to
00072      * SphericalEngine::Value.  This class also includes functions to aid
00073      * indexing into \e C and \e S.
00074      *
00075      * The storage layout of the coefficients is documented in
00076      * SphericalHarmonic and SphericalHarmonic::SphericalHarmonic.
00077      **********************************************************************/
00078     class GEOGRAPHIC_EXPORT coeff {
00079     private:
00080       int _N, _nmx, _mmx;
00081       std::vector<real>::const_iterator _Cnm;
00082       std::vector<real>::const_iterator _Snm;
00083     public:
00084       /**
00085        * A default constructor
00086        **********************************************************************/
00087       coeff()
00088         : _N(-1)
00089         , _nmx(-1)
00090         , _mmx(-1)
00091         , _Cnm(Z_.begin())
00092         , _Snm(Z_.begin()) {}
00093       /**
00094        * The general constructor.
00095        *
00096        * @param[in] C a vector of coefficients for the cosine terms.
00097        * @param[in] S a vector of coefficients for the sine terms.
00098        * @param[in] N the degree giving storage layout for \e C and \e S.
00099        * @param[in] nmx the maximum degree to be used.
00100        * @param[in] mmx the maximum order to be used.
00101        *
00102        * This requires \e N >= \e nmx >= \e mmx >= -1.  \e C and \e S must also
00103        * be large enough to hold the coefficients.  Otherwise an exception is
00104        * thrown.
00105        **********************************************************************/
00106       coeff(const std::vector<real>& C,
00107             const std::vector<real>& S,
00108             int N, int nmx, int mmx)
00109         : _N(N)
00110         , _nmx(nmx)
00111         , _mmx(mmx)
00112         , _Cnm(C.begin())
00113         , _Snm(S.begin() - (_N + 1))
00114       {
00115         if (!(_N >= _nmx && _nmx >= _mmx && _mmx >= -1))
00116           throw GeographicErr("Bad indices for coeff");
00117         if (!(index(_nmx, _mmx) < int(C.size()) &&
00118               index(_nmx, _mmx) < int(S.size()) + (_N + 1)))
00119           throw GeographicErr("Arrays too small in coeff");
00120       }
00121       /**
00122        * The constructor for full coefficient vectors.
00123        *
00124        * @param[in] C a vector of coefficients for the cosine terms.
00125        * @param[in] S a vector of coefficients for the sine terms.
00126        * @param[in] N the maximum degree and order.
00127        *
00128        * This requires \e N >= -1.  \e C and \e S must also be large enough to
00129        * hold the coefficients.  Otherwise an exception is thrown.
00130        **********************************************************************/
00131       coeff(const std::vector<real>& C,
00132             const std::vector<real>& S,
00133             int N)
00134         : _N(N)
00135         , _nmx(N)
00136         , _mmx(N)
00137         , _Cnm(C.begin())
00138         , _Snm(S.begin() - (_N + 1))
00139       {
00140         if (!(_N >= -1))
00141           throw GeographicErr("Bad indices for coeff");
00142         if (!(index(_nmx, _mmx) < int(C.size()) &&
00143               index(_nmx, _mmx) < int(S.size()) + (_N + 1)))
00144           throw GeographicErr("Arrays too small in coeff");
00145       }
00146       /**
00147        * @return \e N the degree giving storage layout for \e C and \e S.
00148        **********************************************************************/
00149       inline int N() const throw() { return _N; }
00150       /**
00151        * @return \e nmx the maximum degree to be used.
00152        **********************************************************************/
00153       inline int nmx() const throw() { return _nmx; }
00154       /**
00155        * @return \e mmx the maximum order to be used.
00156        **********************************************************************/
00157       inline int mmx() const throw() { return _mmx; }
00158       /**
00159        * The one-dimensional index into \e C and \e S.
00160        *
00161        * @param[in] n the degree.
00162        * @param[in] m the order.
00163        * @return the one-dimensional index.
00164        **********************************************************************/
00165       inline int index(int n, int m) const throw()
00166       { return m * _N - m * (m - 1) / 2 + n; }
00167       /**
00168        * An element of \e C.
00169        *
00170        * @param[in] k the one-dimensional index.
00171        * @return the value of the \e C coefficient.
00172        **********************************************************************/
00173       inline Math::real Cv(int k) const { return *(_Cnm + k); }
00174       /**
00175        * An element of \e S.
00176        *
00177        * @param[in] k the one-dimensional index.
00178        * @return the value of the \e S coefficient.
00179        **********************************************************************/
00180       inline Math::real Sv(int k) const { return *(_Snm + k); }
00181       /**
00182        * An element of \e C with checking.
00183        *
00184        * @param[in] k the one-dimensional index.
00185        * @param[in] n the requested degree.
00186        * @param[in] m the requested order.
00187        * @param[in] f a multiplier.
00188        * @return the value of the \e C coefficient multiplied by \e f in \e n
00189        *   and \e m are in range else 0.
00190        **********************************************************************/
00191       inline Math::real Cv(int k, int n, int m, real f) const
00192       { return m > _mmx || n > _nmx ? 0 : *(_Cnm + k) * f; }
00193       /**
00194        * An element of \e S with checking.
00195        *
00196        * @param[in] k the one-dimensional index.
00197        * @param[in] n the requested degree.
00198        * @param[in] m the requested order.
00199        * @param[in] f a multiplier.
00200        * @return the value of the \e S coefficient multiplied by \e f in \e n
00201        *   and \e m are in range else 0.
00202        **********************************************************************/
00203       inline Math::real Sv(int k, int n, int m, real f) const
00204       { return m > _mmx || n > _nmx ? 0 : *(_Snm + k) * f; }
00205 
00206       /**
00207        * The size of the coefficient vector for the cosine terms.
00208        *
00209        * @param[in] N the maximum degree.
00210        * @param[in] M the maximum order.
00211        * @return the size of the vector of cosine terms as stored in column
00212        *   major order.
00213        **********************************************************************/
00214       static inline int Csize(int N, int M)
00215       { return (M + 1) * (2 * N - M + 2) / 2; }
00216 
00217       /**
00218        * The size of the coefficient vector for the sine terms.
00219        *
00220        * @param[in] N the maximum degree.
00221        * @param[in] M the maximum order.
00222        * @return the size of the vector of cosine terms as stored in column
00223        *   major order.
00224        **********************************************************************/
00225       static inline int Ssize(int N, int M)
00226       { return Csize(N, M) - (N + 1); }
00227     };
00228 
00229     /**
00230      * Evaluate a spherical harmonic sum and its gradient.
00231      *
00232      * @tparam gradp should the gradient be calculated.
00233      * @tparam norm the normalization for the associated Legendre polynomials.
00234      * @tparam L the number of terms in the coefficents.
00235      * @param[in] c an array of coeff objects.
00236      * @param[in] f array of coefficient multipliers.  f[0] should be 1.
00237      * @param[in] x the \e x component of the cartesian position.
00238      * @param[in] y the \e y component of the cartesian position.
00239      * @param[in] z the \e z component of the cartesian position.
00240      * @param[in] a the normalizing radius.
00241      * @param[out] gradx the \e x component of the gradient.
00242      * @param[out] grady the \e y component of the gradient.
00243      * @param[out] gradz the \e z component of the gradient.
00244      * @result the spherical harmonic sum.
00245      *
00246      * See the SphericalHarmonic class for the definition of the sum.
00247      * The coefficients used by this function are, for example,
00248      * c[0].Cv + f[1] * c[1].Cv + ... + f[L-1] * c[L-1].Cv.  (Note
00249      * that f[0] is \e not used.)  The upper limits on the sum are
00250      * determined by c[0].nmx() and c[0].mmx(); these limits apply to
00251      * \e all the components of the coefficients.  The parameters \e
00252      * gradp, \e norm, and \e L are template parameters, to allow more
00253      * optimization to be done at compile time.
00254      *
00255      * Clenshaw summation is used which permits the evaluation of the sum
00256      * without the need to allocate temporary arrays.  Thus this function never
00257      * throws an excpetion.
00258      **********************************************************************/
00259     template<bool gradp, normalization norm, int L>
00260       static Math::real Value(const coeff c[], const real f[],
00261                               real x, real y, real z, real a,
00262                               real& gradx, real& grady, real& gradz) throw();
00263 
00264     /**
00265      * Create a CircularEngine object
00266      *
00267      * @tparam gradp should the gradient be calculated.
00268      * @tparam norm the normalization for the associated Legendre polynomials.
00269      * @tparam L the number of terms in the coefficents.
00270      * @param[in] c an array of coeff objects.
00271      * @param[in] f array of coefficient multipliers.  f[0] should be 1.
00272      * @param[in] p the radius of the circle = sqrt(\e x<sup>2</sup> + \e
00273      *   y<sup>2</sup>).
00274      * @param[in] z the height of the circle.
00275      * @param[in] a the normalizing radius.
00276      * @result the CircularEngine object.
00277      *
00278      * If you need to evaluate the spherical harmonic sum for several points
00279      * with constant \e f, \e p = sqrt(\e x<sup>2</sup> + \e y<sup>2</sup>), \e
00280      * z, and \e a, it is more efficient to construct call
00281      * SphericalEngine::Circle to give a CircularEngine object and then call
00282      * CircularEngine::operator()() with arguments \e x/\e p and \e y/\e p.
00283      **********************************************************************/
00284     template<bool gradp, SphericalEngine::normalization norm, int L>
00285       static CircularEngine Circle(const coeff c[], const real f[],
00286                                    real p, real z, real a);
00287   };
00288 
00289 } // namespace GeographicLib
